name: 勞維俊
objective: 課程旨在以跨領域的思考方法，融合文學與批判理論，探討特定主題如何在作品中呈現，思考在不同文化背景和歷史脈絡中的意義，以訓練學生運用和整合在其他學科，甚至其他學術領域學到的能力：諸如藝術和文學風格，社會和哲學思潮等。透過對文本（文學、電影、和其他藝術領域）的細讀和理論的思考和運用，學生可進一步應用跨領域專題研究的方法。可能的專題包括：文學與復仇文化、文學與音樂、電影中的愛與慾、文學與哲學等。

Aims:

This course focuses on a chosen theme in literary and cultural studies, aiming to train students’ ability to investigate, both textually and theoretically, a theme within cultural production. Integrating the knowledge and insights students have acquired in other courses, this course approaches literature comparatively. In the process of examining what a particular theme means across history, students should acquire further techniques which will be important throughout their postgraduate studies.

Outlines: Literature and Revenge 

Virtually all works of literature (great or minor, classic or popular, literary or non-literary) are fascinated by revenge. It seems that the logic of human interactions has been dominated by the logic of vengeance. This course analyses how revenge is represented in cultural production including literature, film and various art works from Greek tragedies to contemporary films, including the European tradition and the modern Asian. 

This course investigates to what extent revenge is ‘natural,’ instead of being culturally produced. Related issues including the concept of justice, the sense of guilt, law, time, gender, identity, anger, and violence will be examined by referring to different theoretical frameworks, including Nietzsche, Freud, Lacan, Foucault, Derrida.
